As a nanoengineer, you work with nanomachines, unfathomably tiny robots capable of massive feats, from stitching together wounds at the microscopic level, to forming extraordinarily resilient materials. Your machines might appear as nothing more than a small blob of gray ooze, but once set to work, their effects are unmistakable.

subclassFeature.name: Cutting-Edge Nanobots
entries: Beginning when you choose this specialty at 3rd level, you have assembled a fabricator which generates a steady stream of advanced nanobots, called nanites. Your supply of nanites is represented by a pool of Nano points equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your gadgeteer level, rounded down. You can expend Nano points to employ your nanobots in varying ways, described below, and you regain all expended Nano points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Deconstruct
entries: As an action, you well up a mass of nanites in your hand and fling them at a target within 15 feet of you. Spend any number of Nano points and make a ranged attack roll if the target is out of your reach; you automatically hit if the target is within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage per Nano point expended as the nanites unravel it at a cellular level.

entries.name: Nano-Hack
entries: You can expend up to 3 Nano points when you make an Intelligence ({@skill Data|DarkMatter}) check to hack a piece of technology, inserting your nanites into the machine. You can add {@dice 1d4} to the roll for each Nano point expended.

entries.name: Reconstruct
entries: As an action, you can expend any number of Nano points to create a thin stream of nanites to repair damage and mend wounds of a willing target within 15 feet of you. The target regains {@dice 1d6} hit points per Nano point expended.

subclassFeature.name: Nano-Duplicate
entries: Also at 3rd level, as a bonus action, you can use your nanites to duplicate the exact shape, but not color or texture, of an object you touch that can fit within a 1-foot cube. The replica is made of nanites and lasts for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Recycling Protocol
entries: Starting at 6th level, you've programmed your nanites to repurpose material and multiply. When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points using a melee weapon attack or your Deconstruct ability, you regain 2 expended Nano points.

subclassFeature.name: Nanite Weave
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can use your action and spend up to 3 Nano points to stitch your nanites together in a protective mesh above your skin. These Nano points are invested in the mesh; you can have up to 3 points invested at once. While you aren't wielding a shield, you gain a bonus to your Armor Class equal to the number of Nano points invested. Whenever you take damage, nanites in the mesh are destroyed and you lose 1 invested point.

subclassFeature.name: Network Response
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use your reaction when you take damage to use your Deconstruct ability, targeting the attacker, or Reconstruct ability, targeting yourself, spending up to 3 Nano points on either ability.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor, or when in high gravity or extreme gravity.

entries.name: Dwarven Engineering Training
entries: Du har färdigheter i {@skill Technology|DarkMatter} och {@item ship maintenance tools|darkmatter}.

fluff.name: Star Dwarf
entries: Star dwarves hail from the dwarven homeworld of Jormund and its associated colonies. They are tough and stout, with a low stature caused by the high gravity of their worlds. Living most of their lives underground or inside ships, these dwarves are pale-skinned and often grow stark white beards. Star dwarves are taught the principles of ship design and engineering from an early age and are among the finest shipwrights in the 'verse.

entries.name: Star Elf Weapon Training
entries: Du behärskar {@item laser halfsword|darkmatter}, {@item laser sword|darkmatter}, {@item photonic lash|darkmatter} och {@item swarm pistol|darkmatter}.

entries.name: Fleet Feet
entries: Din grundläggande gånghastighet ökar till 35 fot.

entries.name: Ironwood Shipwright
entries: Du får färdighet i {@skill Piloting|DarkMatter} och med {@item ship maintenance tools|darkmatter}.

fluff.name: Star Wood Elf
entries: Träälvorna är skogsbrukare och hantverkare som ansvarar för att odla titaniska järnträd och forma dem till levande alvträdsskepp.

entries.name: Traditional Elf Weapon Training
entries: Du behärskar {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb} och {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Academic Interest
entries: Du får färdighet i ett val av {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Data|DarkMatter} eller {@skill Technology|DarkMatter}.

entries.name: Fey Arcana
entries: Du känner till {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip. När du når 3:e nivån kan du kasta {@spell faerie fire|phb} trollformeln en gång med denna egenskap och återfår förmågan att göra det när du avslutar en lång vila. När du når 5:e nivån kan du kasta {@spell misty step|phb} trollformeln en gång med denna egenskap och återfår förmågan att göra det när du avslutar en lång vila. Charisma är din förmåga att kasta trollformler för dessa trollformler.

fluff.name: Star Fey Elf
entries: Mystiker och arkanister, fey alver visar en koppling till Feywild, den dimension av otyglad magi som alverna härstammar från.

entries.name: Star Elf Weapon Training
entries: Du behärskar {@item laser halfsword|darkmatter}, {@item laser sword|darkmatter}, {@item photonic lash|darkmatter} och {@item swarm pistol|darkmatter}.

entries.name: Nocturnal Vision
entries: Dina drow-ögon är vana vid den mörka planeten, Siink. Din {@sense darkvision} har en radie på 90 fot. Du har dock nackdel på Wisdom ({@skill Perception})-kontroller som förlitar sig på synen när du befinner dig i starkt ljus.

entries.name: Covert
entries: När du är gömd och en varelse upptäcker dig med en lyckad visdomskontroll ({@skill Perception}) kan du på nytt försöka att gömma dig med en Dexterity-kontroll ({@skill Stealth}). Om du lyckas, omplacerar du dig tyst och varelsen lägger inte märke till dig. När du väl har använt den här egenskapen kan du inte använda den igen förrän du har avslutat en kort eller lång vila.

entries.name: Drow Subtlety
entries: När du gömmer dig, döljer ett vapen eller försöker utföra någon annan handling som kan ifrågasättas av en varelses passiva Perceptionspoäng, kan du subtrahera 5 från deras poäng.

fluff.name: Star Drow Elf
entries: Drow är spionmästare för Elven Empire och är tränade i alla typer av subtilitet och undanflykter.

entries.name: Retro Technology
entries: När du gör en intelligenskontroll ({@skill Technology|DarkMatter}) för att identifiera gammal magisk teknologi kan du lägga till två gånger din kompetensbonus, istället för den kompetensbonus du normalt tillämpar.

entries.name: Engineer
entries: Du får färdighet i {@item circuitry kit|darkmatter|circuitry kits}. Med hjälp av den här utrustningen kan du spendera 1 timme och material till ett värde av 10 gp för att konstruera en improviserad del av magisk teknologi. Du kan bygga en {@item flashlight|darkmatter}, en {@item comm set|darkmatter} eller en {@item igniter|darkmatter}. Apparaten upphör att fungera efter 24 timmar (om du inte spenderar 1 timme på att reparera den för att hålla apparaten fungerande), eller när du använder din handling för att demontera den; vid den tidpunkten kan du återta de material som användes för att skapa den. Du kan ha en improviserad anordning åt gången.

fluff.name: Star Gnome
entries: Star gnomes born aboard the Flotilla or on Nebillion are consistently gifted scientists and engineers, with an inborn eye for details and a knack for innovation.

entries.name: Naturally Shrewd
entries: Du får en färdighet i {@skill Persuasion}. Dessutom har du en fördel på alla färdighetskontroller du gör som rör pengar, affärer, rättsliga förfaranden eller liknande.

fluff.name: Star Halfling
entries: Star halflings are every bit as friendly as their terrestrial kin, and twice as canny, especially when it comes to matters of coin. Few can make allies or strike bargains as decisively as a halfling from Hearthmund.

This magical blaster has a revolving set of five power cells. As an action or bonus action on your turn, you can change the blaster's damage type to cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or radiant damage. Additionally, this blaster deals a bonus {@damage 1d6} damage on a hit.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Afterburners
entries: Your ship's movement speed increases by 500 feet if the pilot moves it in a straight line.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: AI Core
entries: Your ship's computer has an installed construct core that manifests a sentient shipboard artificial intelligence. This AI serves to keep the ship in running order and has some interaction with all of the ship's systems, allowing it to see and hear every part of the ship and control all of its systems. It can communicate with the ship's passengers via the ship's computer system and any built-in intercom systems on the ship.

The AI has an Intelligence of 17, a Charisma of 14, and a Wisdom of 13. It is proficient in Technology (+5) and Data (+5). It can make Intelligence checks when any situation arises and will inform its passengers of any information it knows.

Additionally, at a crew member's command, the AI can directly assume any character role aboard the ship. The AI can perform any action provided by that role, taking its turn at the end of the initiative order. The ship adds +3 to all of its attack rolls.

AI personalities can vary wildly. Some are snarky and occasionally play jokes on their crew, while others are fiercely logical and derive pleasure chiefly from calculating probabilities to dozens of decimal places. All, however, generally enjoy their hulls and decks being cleaned regularly.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Antivirus Module

entries.name: Cost
entries: 750 gp
Your ship has a secondary arcane terminal which screens all access to the ship computer for hacking attempts. Any attempt to hack the ship's computer or any system or door control has disadvantage.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Arcana-Resistant Coating
entries: Any crew member that must make a saving throw to resist a magic effect originating from outside the ship can add +2 to the roll.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Assault Port
entries: Dogfighters can deploy from your ship as a bonus action, rather than an action.
Your ship must have the Dogfighter role to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Captain's Chair
entries: Your ship comes equipped with a luxurious command chair, laden with communication controls and a single prominent red button. The captain can take one of their special actions as a bonus action, and regains the ability to do so after 24 hours. The captain can't take the same special action twice on the same turn.
Your ship must have the Captain role to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Countermeasures
entries: Your ship has a series of flares or a deployable decoy designed to confuse the targeting of a pursuing vessel. You can trigger your countermeasures as a reaction when you are targeted by an attack, causing that attack to have disadvantage. Once you use your countermeasures, you must load a new set in a process which takes 1 minute.
Your ship must be fighter-sized to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Cruising Engines
entries: Your ship's sublight speed is doubled.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Ded Reckoner
entries: Your ship has a complex flight computer, which attempts to calculate a course through the Void. When you make a blind void jump, you can add +5 to the roll.
Your ship must have a {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Detonation Failsafe
entries: Your ship is less likely to suffer catastrophic failure and has advantage on detonation saving throws.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Expanded Hold
entries: Your ship's cargo capacity increases by 50%.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: External Manipulators
entries: A pair of extensible clawed arms can fold out from the hull of your ship or fold down again as an action. These arms can reach up 50 feet and can each push, pull, or grip with a maximum force of 1,000 pounds.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Expanded Quarters
entries: Your ship can hold 25% more passengers (rounded up) above its normal capacity without overly taxing the life support during long voyages.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Internal Reinforcements
entries: You have improved the integrity of your fighter by filling every hollow space with lightweight reinforcements. Your fighter's mega hit points increases by 10.
Your ship must be fighter-sized to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Jump Rift
entries: When your ship makes a void jump, any ship within 500 feet of it is carried with it when it jumps.
Your ship must have a {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Lifeform Scanner
entries: You enhance your ship's sensors to be able to detect living creatures. The ship's engineer can spend 1 minute to scan a ship within 100 miles to determine the exact number of living humanoids onboard.
Your ship must have {@item sensors|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Live Feed

entries.name: Cost
entries: 750 gp

Your communications system provides a live video feed or holographic image of both parties. The recipient can choose whether or not to mask their image from your feed. Both parties must have a live feed to use this upgrade.
Your ship must have {@item communications|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Material Analyzer
entries: Your sensors have been upgraded with a directional scanner that determines a target's composition. The ship's engineer can spend 1 minute to scan a target within 1,000 miles, learning by percent which metals, minerals, and materials make up the target.
Your ship must have {@item sensors|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Medical Station
entries: A complete overhaul of your ship's sickbay has made it analogous to a small hospital. Your sickbay has twice as many (12) medical dice. Additionally, you can spend 1 minute and expend 3 medical dice to remove a level of exhaustion from yourself or another creature in the sickbay, or to end one of the following conditions afflicting you or another creature in the sickbay: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.
Your ship must have a {@item sickbay|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Overshield
entries: An additional generator is added to supplement the shields, increasing your ship's maximum shield points by 6.
Your ship must have a {@item shield generator|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Panic Drive
entries: Your ship's Dark Matter engine has been heavily customized with a secondary arcane engine to pump energy into the core for faster, but more erratic charging times. Once the engineer has taken the Void Jump action to charge the Dark Matter engine, they can use their action on each of their subsequent turns to panic jump the Dark Matter drive, possibly jumping early. Roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, the ship jumps early.
Your ship must have a {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter} to accept this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Radio Array
entries: Your ship can communicate with another ship out to a range of 10,000 miles, rather than 1,000 miles. If the receiving ship has communications but does not have this upgrade, it can receive messages, but not transmit replies.
Your ship must have {@item communications|darkmatter} to receive this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Reinforced Hull
entries: Great alloyed bands are attached on the exterior of the hull, increasing your ship's AC by 1.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Repair Drones
entries: A series of mechanized drones patrol the outer side of the hull, automatically sealing leaks and repairing structural damage. If your ship is below half its hit point maximum, it regains 1 mega hit point at the beginning of the initiative order.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Targeting Optics
entries: One installed ship weapon of your choice gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and its range increases by 500 feet. You can choose this upgrade more than once, applying it to a different weapon each time.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Tri-Probe
entries: Instead of holding only one drone, your probe bay instead holds three. Each of these probes can be controlled independently.
Your ship must have a {@vehicle probe|darkmatter} to receive this upgrade.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

vehicleUpgrade.name: Smuggler's Hold

entries.name: Cost
entries: 750 gp

Your ship has hidden compartments in its hold, perfect for smuggling. These compartments can hold up to 1,000 pounds (which don't count against your ship's cargo capacity) in objects no larger than 6 feet in any dimension.

entries.name: Ship Upgrades
entries: Starships can be outfitted with an array of upgrades that aren't as modular as replacing a weapon or adding a new system. Each of these upgrades can be installed on a ship once, unless otherwise specified. You can install a new system with 7 days of work and a cost in materials and labor as shown above.

The eerie blue-green lights and uncanny, saucer-like silhouettes of amoeboid ships are no stranger to any world. Coming and going in the middle of the night to dissect livestock and experiment on intelligent creatures, amoeboid ships are somewhat infamous for their role in researching primitive worlds. More often, however, amoeboid saucers and motherships can be found hovering around and leaping between maw stations, their symmetric, sophisticated designs perfectly reflecting that of most amoeboid technology, including much of the maws themselves.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet. Ett större skepp kan till exempel bära fler män och fler vapen, men ett mindre skepp kan springa ifrån och manövrera det. Olika storleksklassificeringar beskrivs i detalj i tabellen Storleksklassificering nedan.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. På mycket höga nivåer kan karaktärer värva en besättning för att bemanna en fregatt eller till och med en hel flotta.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Reactive Design
entries: When this ship takes mega damage, it can immediately move up to 1,000 feet in any direction and change the direction it faces.

entries.name: Lightning Coil
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 2,000/6,000 ft., one target. {@h}9 (half {@damage 3d12}) mega lightning damage or 36 ({@damage 6d12}) mega lightning damage if the damage is dealt to shields. If this damage reduces a ship's shields points to 0, remaining damage is not subtracted from hit points.

entries.name: Cargo

entries.name: Advanced Shielding
entries: This ship's shields cover two of its sides, instead of one. These sides must be adjacent to each other.

entries.name: Reactive Design
entries: When this ship takes mega damage, it can immediately move up to 1,000 feet in any direction and change the direction it faces.

entries.name: 4 x Lightning Coil
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 2,000/6,000 ft., one target each. {@h}9 (half {@damage 3d12}) mega lightning damage or 36 ({@damage 6d12}) mega lightning damage if the damage is dealt to shields. If this damage reduces a ship's shields points to 0, remaining damage is not subtracted from hit points.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell lightning bolt})
entries: A stroke of lightning forming a line of 10,000 feet long and 500 feet wide blasts out from this ship in a direction chosen by the caster. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) mega lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The mighty arm of the avia-ra in the Holy Lands is the Congregation, a fleet of righteous ships dedicated to carrying the fury and enlightenment of the Sun Above to heretics the universe over. Its flagship, The Prophet, is a vessel of terrifying might, and is said to have burned its mark into every elven ship it crossed during the days of the Night Crusade. Now, it slumbers peacefully with much of the Congregation in a large perimeter around the Sepulcher Star, awaiting another grand Crusade.

Avia-Ra ships demonstrate a meeting of traditional design, canny ingenuity, and startling ruthlessness. There is no better evidence of this than the scorchers borne by most ships in the Congregation: a powerful symbol of the Sun's might, and also a deceptively simple circumvention of elven shield technology.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Engines
entries: {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter|Dark Matter} (Class 4), Impulse (2,500 feet): Maneuverability (90)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item arcane cannon|darkmatter}, {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item fabricator|darkmatter}, {@item life pods|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}, {@item teleporters|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 4 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Pilgrim|darkmatter}), Engineer, 5 Gunners, Pilot, 140 passengers

entries.name: Cargo
entries: 4000 tons

entries.name: Annealed Hull
entries: This ship has resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Blink Teleport (1/Day)
entries: This ship can use all of its movement to teleport to any unoccupied space within 6,000 feet, facing any direction it wishes.

entries.name: Zealous Fury
entries: When this ship has 50 mega hit points remaining or fewer, it has advantage on its attack rolls.

entries.name: 2 x Pulse Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed front, one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

entries.name: 2 x Scorcher
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 1,000/3,000 ft., one target each. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega fire damage. This damage bypasses a ship's shields.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell flame strike})
entries: A column of divine fire roars down. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in a 1,000-foot radius, 4,000-foot high cylinder centered on a point within 6,000 feet must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) mega fire damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) mega radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The mighty arm of the avia-ra in the Holy Lands is the Congregation, a fleet of righteous ships dedicated to carrying the fury and enlightenment of the Sun Above to heretics the universe over. Its flagship, The Prophet, is a vessel of terrifying might, and is said to have burned its mark into every elven ship it crossed during the days of the Night Crusade. Now, it slumbers peacefully with much of the Congregation in a large perimeter around the Sepulcher Star, awaiting another grand Crusade.

Avia-Ra ships demonstrate a meeting of traditional design, canny ingenuity, and startling ruthlessness. There is no better evidence of this than the scorchers borne by most ships in the Congregation: a powerful symbol of the Sun's might, and also a deceptively simple circumvention of elven shield technology.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet. Ett större skepp kan till exempel bära fler män och fler vapen, men ett mindre skepp kan springa ifrån och manövrera det. Olika storleksklassificeringar beskrivs i detalj i tabellen Storleksklassificering nedan.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. På mycket höga nivåer kan karaktärer värva en besättning för att bemanna en fregatt eller till och med en hel flotta.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 8 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Pilgrim|darkmatter}), Engineer, 9 Gunners, Pilot, 7,750 passengers

entries.name: Annealed Hull
entries: This ship has resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Blink Teleport (3/Day)
entries: This ship can use all of its movement to teleport to any unoccupied space within 6,000 feet, facing any direction it wishes.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the ship's pilot fails a saving throw on behalf of the ship, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Zealous Fury
entries: When this ship has 84 mega hit points remaining or fewer, it has advantage on its attack rolls.

entries.name: 6 x Scorcher, Improved
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 3,000/9,000 ft., one target each. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d8}) mega fire damage. This damage bypasses a ship's shields.

entries.name: Starbuster
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 12,000/36,000 ft., fixed front, one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) mega radiant damage. This weapon then overheats, and can't be fired again until the end of the ship's next turn.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell fire storm})
entries: Ten 1,000-foot cubes of flame appear in free space, arranged around hostile ships. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the area of a cube must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. It takes 38 ({@damage 7d10}) mega fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Broadside
entries: The ship fires a volley from either its left or right side. This attack affects a rectangular area 6,000 feet long, extending from the side of the ship in a straight line. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) mega fire damage, or half as much on a successful one.

other.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The ship can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Fire At Will
entries: The ship performs a barrage. It can make an attack with two weapons or make a broadside attack.

entries.name: Full Speed Ahead
entries: The ship moves half its movement speed within the cone of movement.

entries.name: Repairs
entries: The ship regains {@damage 2d12} mega hit points.

Dwarven shipwrights are renowned for their craftsmanship and engineering, and as such, dwarven ships are the gold standard for quality and dependability. If properly maintained, a dwarven vessel can see centuries of continuous use, long outliving its creators. These machines are designed to tackle tough jobs—asteroid mining, interstellar hauling, and deep space salvage—and are named appropriately, but never seem to break down; indeed, they almost seem to perform better when the going gets rough.
Dwarven starship designs and innovations have been adapted and emulated by all comers, leaving the marks of Jormund engineers on human, vect, and avia-ra ships.

Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet. Ett större skepp kan till exempel bära fler män och fler vapen, men ett mindre skepp kan springa ifrån och manövrera det. Olika storleksklassificeringar beskrivs i detalj i tabellen Storleksklassificering nedan.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. På mycket höga nivåer kan karaktärer värva en besättning för att bemanna en fregatt eller till och med en hel flotta.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Engines
entries: {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter|Dark Matter} (Class 4), Impulse (1,500 feet): Maneuverability (90)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item arcane cannon|darkmatter}, {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item fabricator|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}, {@vehicle shuttle|darkmatter}, {@item sickbay|darkmatter}, {@item tractor beam|darkmatter}, {@item umbilicus|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 4 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Hammer|darkmatter}), Engineer, 5 Gunners, Pilot, 130 passengers

entries.name: Cargo
entries: 7,500 tons

entries.name: Armored Hull
entries: Once per turn when this ship takes damage, it can reduce the damage taken by 5 ({@damage 1d10}) mega hit points.

entries.name: Breakdown-Proof
entries: This ship's systems, weapons, and engines have 20 mega hit points, rather than 10.

entries.name: Ram
entries: This ship is designed such that it can directly collide with another ship and survive (mostly) unscathed. When this happens, the target ship takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) mega bludgeoning damage, and this ship takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) mega bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sturdy Design
entries: When this ship would drop to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1 mega hit point. Once it uses this ability, it can't do so again until it is fully repaired to its maximum hit points.

entries.name: Antimatter Mine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, deployable 0 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) mega necrotic damage.

entries.name: Mining Laser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 1,500/4,500 ft., fixed front, one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) mega radiant damage or 33 ({@damage 6d10}) mega radiant damage if the target hasn't moved in the last round.

entries.name: 2x Pulse Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed front and rear, one target each. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell fireball})
entries: Pick a point within 10,000 feet. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in a 2,000- foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) mega fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Dwarven shipwrights are renowned for their craftsmanship and engineering, and as such, dwarven ships are the gold standard for quality and dependability. If properly maintained, a dwarven vessel can see centuries of continuous use, long outliving its creators. These machines are designed to tackle tough jobs—asteroid mining, interstellar hauling, and deep space salvage—and are named appropriately, but never seem to break down; indeed, they almost seem to perform better when the going gets rough.
Dwarven starship designs and innovations have been adapted and emulated by all comers, leaving the marks of Jormund engineers on human, vect, and avia-ra ships.

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item arcane cannon|darkmatter}, {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item fabricator|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@vehicle probe|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}, {@vehicle shuttle|darkmatter}, {@item sickbay|darkmatter}, {@item tractor beam|darkmatter}, {@item umbilicus|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 12 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Hammer|darkmatter}), Engineer, 7 Gunners, Pilot, 40,000 passengers

entries.name: Arcane Reinforcement
entries: The pilot of this ship has advantage on all saving throws against spells it makes on behalf of the ship.

entries.name: Armored Hull
entries: Once per turn when this ship takes damage, it can reduce the damage taken by 5 ({@damage 1d10}) mega hit points.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: Once per turn when this ship takes damage, it can reduce the damage taken by 5 ({@damage 1d10}) mega hit points.

entries.name: Breakdown-Proof
entries: This ship's systems, weapons, and engines have 20 mega hit points, rather than 10.

entries.name: 3 x Antimatter Mine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, deployable 0 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) mega necrotic damage.

entries.name: 2x Pulse Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed front, one target each. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell chain lightning})
entries: A bolt of lightning arcs toward a target within 15,000 feet. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 3,000 feet of the first target. A target can be a mega creature, an object, or a ship, and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.
A target must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) mega lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entries.name: Broadside
entries: A target must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) mega lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

other.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The ship can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Fire At Will
entries: The ship performs a barrage. It can make an attack with two weapons or make a broadside attack.

entries.name: Full Speed Ahead
entries: The ship moves half its movement speed within the cone of movement.

entries.name: Repairs
entries: The ship regains {@damage 2d20} mega hit points.

Elven ships aren't so much constructed as grown, shaped from living ironwood trees. Indeed, there are few vessels in existence that can match an elven ship for beauty or speed. Many are made to resemble traditional sailing ships, with similar bows, sails, and open decks, but all components are formed from great boughs and limbs of ironwood. Pound for pound, no metal can match ironwood for strength, and elven ships rely on this strength and lightness to achieve extreme maneuverability.

As elven ships grow larger, they become more arboreal, with weapons mounted in high limbs and engines fixed in the deepest roots. The grandest of vessels, such as The Hyperion, are thriving cities in their own right, centers of arcane knowledge, and symbols of elven superiority for the rest of the 'verse.

Pound for pound, no metal can match ironwood for strength, and elven ships rely on this strength and lightness to achieve extreme maneuverability.

As elven ships grow larger, they become more arboreal, with weapons mounted in high limbs and engines fixed in the deepest roots. The grandest of vessels, such as The Hyperion, are thriving cities in their own right, centers of arcane knowledge, and symbols of elven superiority for the rest of the 'verse.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet. Ett större skepp kan till exempel bära fler män och fler vapen, men ett mindre skepp kan springa ifrån och manövrera det. Olika storleksklassificeringar beskrivs i detalj i tabellen Storleksklassificering nedan.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. På mycket höga nivåer kan karaktärer värva en besättning för att bemanna en fregatt eller till och med en hel flotta.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Engines
entries: {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter|Dark Matter} (Class 9), Impulse (1,500 feet): Maneuverability (45)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item arcane cannon|darkmatter}, {@item cloaking|darkmatter}, {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item fabricator|darkmatter}, {@item life pods|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@vehicle probe|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}, {@item sickbay|darkmatter}, {@item simulator|darkmatter}, {@item teleporters|darkmatter}, {@item tractor beam|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 10 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Interceptor|darkmatter}), Engineer, 9 Gunners, Pilot, 35,000 passengers

entries.name: Arcane Reinforcement
entries: The pilot of this ship has advantage on all saving throws against spells it makes on behalf of the ship.

entries.name: Illusory Fleet
entries: When this ship produces fighters, it appears to produce twice as many fighters as it actually does; every other ship is produces is an illusory copy, strengthened by evocation magic. Each of these illusory ships can make attacks and deal damage as normal, but disappears immediately upon taking damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the ship's pilot fails a saving throw on behalf of the ship, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Nimble Design
entries: On any turn that this ship doesn't fire its weapons, its speed increases by 1,000 feet for that turn.

entries.name: Regrowth
entries: If this ship has fewer than 65 mega hit points at the beginning of the initiative order, it regains 20 mega hit points.

entries.name: 4 x Neutron Torpedo
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, deployable 6,000 ft., one target each. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) mega force damage.

entries.name: 3 x Pulse Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed front, rear, and rear, one target each. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell chain lightning})
entries: A bolt of lightning arcs toward a target within 15,000 feet. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 3,000 feet of the first target. A target can be a mega creature, an object, or a ship and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

A target must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw (or, if the target is a ship, its pilot must make a Dexterity saving throw). The target takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) mega lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entries.name: Broadside
entries: The ship fires a volley from either its left or right side. This attack affects a rectangular area 6,000 feet long, extending from the side of the ship in a straight line. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) mega radiant damage, or half as much on a successful one.

other.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The ship can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Fire At Will
entries: The ship performs a barrage. It can make an attack with two weapons or make a broadside attack.

entries.name: Full Speed Ahead
entries: The ship moves half its movement speed within the cone of movement.

entries.name: Repairs
entries: The ship regains {@damage 2d20} mega hit points.

A bitter diatribe on prevailing magical technology, gnomish vessels are the epitome of high-tech, cruising through the stars without so much as an arcane battery. As such, gnomes can fly without hindrance into Dead Magic Zones and can penetrate deep into the uncharted territory beyond. The largest Dead Magic Zones even provide some measure of protection for the Gnomish Flotilla, the permanent armada of gnomish ships, and demonstrate the spite most gnomes hold for magic in general: even approaching the Flotilla from the wrong angle will strand an ordinary ship without power in the Black, a death sentence for those who are not promptly rescued.

The advances and complexities of gnomish ships are due to their growing mastery of a baffling art known as science. Guided by this philosophy, gnomish ships are apt to follow different naming conventions: blasters are more likely to be called lasers, sickbays are more likely to be called hospitals, and so on.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' When humans look at the vast emptiness of space, they're not crushed by a weight of burden, nor are they confounded by its meaning; they are instead overwhelmed by an urge to explore. Humans are a young race in the grand scheme of things, but they have made leaps and bounds technologically, bolstering the Hegemony and setting human spacecraft apart from others.

Pragmatic almost to a fault, human ships are always purpose-driven in form. Freelancers excel for lone agents, Explorers can probe the farthest depths of space, and Warbringers are utterly ruthless in combat. Regardless of intended function, human ships are innovative and rugged, capable of meeting any trial the 'verse throws their way.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Engines
entries: Impulse (3,500 feet): Maneuverability (180)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Pilot, 1 passenger

entries.name: Innovative Design
entries: The crew of this ship has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Pulse Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed front, one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

When humans look at the vast emptiness of space, they're not crushed by a weight of burden, nor are they confounded by its meaning; they are instead overwhelmed by an urge to explore. Humans are a young race in the grand scheme of things, but they have made leaps and bounds technologically, bolstering the Hegemony and setting human spacecraft apart from others.

Pragmatic almost to a fault, human ships are always purpose-driven in form. Freelancers excel for lone agents, Explorers can probe the farthest depths of space, and Warbringers are utterly ruthless in combat. Regardless of intended function, human ships are innovative and rugged, capable of meeting any trial the 'verse throws their way.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet. Ett större skepp kan till exempel bära fler män och fler vapen, men ett mindre skepp kan springa ifrån och manövrera det. Olika storleksklassificeringar beskrivs i detalj i tabellen Storleksklassificering nedan.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. På mycket höga nivåer kan karaktärer värva en besättning för att bemanna en fregatt eller till och med en hel flotta.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item arcane cannon|darkmatter}, {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item fabricator|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}, {@vehicle shuttle|darkmatter}, {@item sickbay|darkmatter}, {@item teleporters|darkmatter}, {@item tractor beam|darkmatter}, {@item umbilicus|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 8 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Sabre|darkmatter}), Engineer, 10 Gunners, Pilot, 7,750 passengers

entries.name: High-G Turn
entries: This ship can rotate the direction it faces before it moves, instead of after it moves.

entries.name: Innovative Design
entries: The crew of this ship has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the ship's pilot fails a saving throw on behalf of the ship, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: 3 x Auto Turret
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 3,000/9,000 ft., one target each. {@h}7 ({@damage 3d4}) mega radiant damage.

entries.name: 2 x Neutron Torpedo
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, deployable 6,000 ft., one target each. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) mega force damage.

entries.name: 2 x Pulse Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed left, right, one target each. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

entries.name: Railgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 12,000/36,000 ft., fixed front, one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 3d20}) mega force damage. This weapon then overheats, and can't be fired again until the end of the ship's next turn.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell chain lightning})
entries: A bolt of lightning arcs toward a target within 15,000 feet. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 3,000 feet of the first target. A target can be a mega creature, an object, or a ship and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

A target must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw (or, if the target is a ship, its pilot must make a Dexterity saving throw). The target takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) mega lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entries.name: Broadside
entries: The ship fires a volley from either its left or right side. This attack affects a rectangular area 6,000 feet long, extending from the side of the ship in a straight line. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) mega radiant damage, or half as much on a successful one.

other.name: Legendary Actions
entries: The ship can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Spent legendary actions are regained at the start of each turn.

entries.name: Fire At Will
entries: The ship performs a barrage. It can make an attack with two weapons or make a broadside attack.

entries.name: Full Speed Ahead
entries: The ship moves half its movement speed within the cone of movement.

entries.name: Repairs
entries: The ship regains {@damage 2d20} mega hit points.

The Lakshayan people are warriors, ever battle-hardened against the Warhorde, and their ships are a testament to their readiness. In the War of Expansion, the garrison at Lakshay needed a weapon that could engage the goblinoid enemy on land, in the air, and in space, and they had little resources to accomplish this, apart from a new shipment of impulse frames, designed with space marines in mind. With these frames, the Lakshayan engineers devised the first Battle Frame, a gargantuan, rocket-powered, mechanized exoskeleton, armed with a sword and salvos of micro-missiles. Each Frame requires a seasoned pilot, but their sheer versatility and mobility makes them a terror to orcs, and a devastating weapon for any theater of conflict.

More than just a ship, a Lakshayan battle frame is an extension of the pilot, and using one is a dance of tactical maneuvers and precision strikes. The deadliest Lakshayan pilots, called Oni, are as fearsome in person as they are in a frame.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Engines
entries: Impulse (3,000 feet): Maneuverability (360)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Pilot

entries.name: Cargo
entries: 500 lb

entries.name: Frame
entries: This ship is a humanoid battle frame, capable of wielding weapons and taking actions that a normal human could. This ship can walk on land with a movement speed of 2,000 feet. The pilot can use its action to Dash (on land only), Disengage, or Dodge while in this ship. This ship can't target creatures smaller than mega size.
At the GM's discretion, the pilot of this ship can use actions and features (such as Sneak Attack) they would normally be capable of, as long as such an action is reasonable for the frame to take.

entries.name: Naginata
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 1,000 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) mega slashing damage. The pilot must have {@item halberd|phb} proficiency to use this weapon.

entries.name: M-Laser {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 1,500/4,500 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) mega force damage.

The Lakshayan people are warriors, ever battle-hardened against the Warhorde, and their ships are a testament to their readiness. In the War of Expansion, the garrison at Lakshay needed a weapon that could engage the goblinoid enemy on land, in the air, and in space, and they had little resources to accomplish this, apart from a new shipment of impulse frames, designed with space marines in mind. With these frames, the Lakshayan engineers devised the first Battle Frame, a gargantuan, rocket-powered, mechanized exoskeleton, armed with a sword and salvos of micro-missiles. Each Frame requires a seasoned pilot, but their sheer versatility and mobility makes them a terror to orcs, and a devastating weapon for any theater of conflict.

More than just a ship, a Lakshayan battle frame is an extension of the pilot, and using one is a dance of tactical maneuvers and precision strikes. The deadliest Lakshayan pilots, called Oni, are as fearsome in person as they are in a frame.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet. Ett större skepp kan till exempel bära fler män och fler vapen, men ett mindre skepp kan springa ifrån och manövrera det. Olika storleksklassificeringar beskrivs i detalj i tabellen Storleksklassificering nedan.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. entries: Impulse (3,000 feet): Maneuverability (360)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item hypercapacitor|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, Engineer, Pilot, 2 Gunners

entries.name: Cargo
entries: 4 tons

entries.name: All-Around Shielding
entries: This ship's shield covers it on all sides, instead of one.

entries.name: Combined Frame
entries: This frame is comprised of three to five fighter-sized frames, which undergo a complex transformation process to interconnect into this larger humanoid frame. This ship's melee weapons are determined by each of its constituent frames: it has two of those melee weapons at once, and the gunners can switch which weapons are active as a bonus action. The ship's HP is equal to the sum of all its constituent ships' HP.
The pilots of each constituent ship can assume any of this ship's roles.

This ship is a humanoid battle frame, capable of wielding weapons and taking actions that a normal human could. This ship can walk on land with a movement speed of 2,000 feet. The pilot can use its action to Dash (on land only), Disengage, or Dodge while in this ship. This ship can't target creatures smaller than mega size.

At the GM's discretion, the pilot and gunners of this ship can use actions and features (such as Sneak Attack) they would normally be capable of, as long as such an action is reasonable for the frame to take.

entries.name: Weakpoint
entries: Once per turn, when this ship hits with a melee weapon attack, it can add an extra {@damage 2d8} mega damage to the roll if the target is below its hit point maximum.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries: The frame makes four attacks with its mega laser sword.

entries.name: Mega Laser Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 500 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) mega radiant damage. The gunners must have {@item laser sword|darkmatter} proficiency to use this weapon.

entries.name: Ultima Cannon {@recharge 5}
entries: You fire a staggering chromatic beam in a 6,000-foot long, 500-foot wide line. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 6,000/18,000 ft., fixed 2 x front and rear, one target each. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) mega radiant damage.

entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 9,000 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) mega acid damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) mega acid damage at the end of the target's next turn. On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

entries: {@item Dark Matter Engine|darkmatter|Dark Matter} (Class 5), Impulse (2,000 feet): Maneuverability (45)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item arcane cannon|darkmatter}, {@item cloaking|darkmatter}, {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item fabricator|darkmatter}, {@item hypercapacitor|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter}, {@item sensors|darkmatter}, {@item shield generator|darkmatter}, {@vehicle shuttle|darkmatter}, {@item sickbay|darkmatter}, {@item simulator|darkmatter}, {@item teleporters|darkmatter}, {@item umbilicus|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Captain, 6 Dogfighters ({@vehicle Battle Frame|darkmatter}), Engineer, 7 Gunners, Pilot, 2,250 passengers

entries.name: Cargo
entries: 70,000 tons

entries.name: Launch Platform
entries: Fighters which deploy from this ship can move and take an action immediately after they are deployed.

entries.name: Tactical Advantage
entries: Once per turn, when this ship makes an attack roll and misses, it can immediately repeat the attack against another target within range, rolling a separate attack for the new target.

entries.name: 4 x Missile Barrage
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 1,500/4,500 ft., one target each. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) mega force damage.

entries.name: Railgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 12,000/36,000 ft., fixed front, one target each. {@h}31 ({@damage 3d20}) mega force damage. This weapon then overheats, and can't be fired again until the end of the ship's next turn.

entries.name: Arcane Cannon ({@spell cone of cold})
entries: Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in a 6,000-foot cone must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. A target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) mega cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Broadside
entries: The ship fires a volley from either its left or right side. This attack affects a rectangular area 6,000 feet long, extending from the side of the ship in a straight line. Each mega creature and the pilot of each ship in the area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) mega radiant damage, or half as much on a successful one.

Lonely nautilid whorl ships wander the galaxy, searching for a world that might not even exist. When their homeworld of Poseidon was destroyed, the only haven left to the nautilid race were their immense ships, filled with the rare aqueous solution in which they can thrive. Indeed, whereas other ships and life suits are designed to withhold a volume of air, nautilid ships and suits are pumped with water and a cocktail of minerals specific to their race. Visitors to nautilid ships, therefore, need to prepare as if going on a deep dive or a spacewalk before coming aboard.

The design of whorl ships, and the smaller pincer ships, are inspired by the long-dead undersea creatures of Poseidon; their hulls resemble great shells, and their landing gear, immense legs. True to their name, pincers are even armed with immense crab claws, capable of shredding smaller craft in a matter of minutes.

Fartygen nämner också vilken ras som vanligtvis bygger den typen av fartyg. Detta har ingen mekanisk effekt i sig. Istället ger det en uppfattning om vilka typer av varelser som kan styra dem och vilken statistik du kan förvänta dig av den typen av skepp. Till exempel är Hammers, som är dvärgkrigare, robust byggda och har en högre rustningsklass än många andra krigare som ett resultat av detta.

Dessutom anger tabellen Ship Classification fartygsklassificering fartygets storlek i fot och dess storlek med hjälp av de valfria reglerna för Grid Combat. De angivna storlekarna är maximala storlekar.

entries.name: Character Level
entries: Ett typiskt äventyrsgrupp kan börja sina äventyr med ett blygsamt personligt skepp och investera i större, mer kapabla fartyg när deras förmögenhet växer. Större grupper kommer dock att finna lastutrymmet och besättningskapaciteten hos ett transportskepp nödvändig. På mycket höga nivåer kan karaktärer värva en besättning för att bemanna en fregatt eller till och med en hel flotta.

I allmänhet har ett partis karaktärsnivå ingen betydelse för fartygsstorlek (och i förlängningen för fartygets stridskraft), men en GM kan ge ett parti större fartyg när de ökar i nivå. Därför innehåller tabellen Ship Classification också en rekommenderad karaktärsnivå för vissa fartygsstorlekar.

entries.name: Engines
entries: Impulse (3,500 feet): Maneuverability (180)

entries.name: Systems
entries: {@item communications|darkmatter}, {@item life support|darkmatter} (ship contains water instead of air), {@item sensors|darkmatter}

entries.name: Crew
entries: Pilot, 2 passengers

entries.name: Armored Hull
entries: Once per turn when this ship takes damage, it can reduce the damage taken by 5 ({@damage 1d10}) mega hit points.

entries.name: Ram
entries: This ship is designed such that it can directly collide with another ship and survive (mostly) unscathed. When this happens, the target ship takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) mega bludgeoning damage, and this ship takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) mega bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: 2 x Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 500 ft., one target each. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d12}) mega bludgeoning damage and, if the target is a ship of Transport size or smaller, it can't move until the pincer releases it.

Lonely nautilid whorl ships wander the galaxy, searching for a world that might not even exist. When their homeworld of Poseidon was destroyed, the only haven left to the nautilid race were their immense ships, filled with the rare aqueous solution in which they can thrive. Indeed, whereas other ships and life suits are designed to withhold a volume of air, nautilid ships and suits are pumped with water and a cocktail of minerals specific to their race. Visitors to nautilid ships, therefore, need to prepare as if going on a deep dive or a spacewalk before coming aboard.

The design of whorl ships, and the smaller pincer ships, are inspired by the long-dead undersea creatures of Poseidon; their hulls resemble great shells, and their landing gear, immense legs. True to their name, pincers are even armed with immense crab claws, capable of shredding smaller craft in a matter of minutes.

entries.name: Ship Traits
entries: The common saying goes: 'No two ships in the 'verse are alike.' Though any mechanic will tell you that this isn't exactly true, the meld of magic and technology spacefaring vessels employ to cross the gulfs of space vary in thousands of ways. Even ships laid down in the same yard to the same specification are likely to go through multiple refits, overhauls, and repairs during their lives, leaving them unrecognizable after a few years in the Black.

entries.name: Size Classification
entries: Fartyg kategoriseras enligt storleksklassning, vilket i allmänhet avgör andra viktiga aspekter: besättningsstorlek, högsta hastighet utanför tomrumshopp, manövrerbarhet och hållbarhet.
